item.description:
We'll be digging into the representational theory of the mind; the idea that all that happens in the mind -- consciousness, intentionality, meaning and all that -- is best seen as an act of representation. It's a popular view, but as with almost all theories in the philosophy of mind, I have my grave doubts that there's really anything in the box past the packaging...

I'll start us out with a mini-presentation that I'll try to post this week. We'll also visit the subject at the next meetup, since Amy has promised to present Wittgenstein soon.

Anyway, a good but long winded background source is the Standord Encyclopedia of Philosophy

Seeya there

Sean
